recommended_movies: The Man Who Shot Liberty Valance (1962)

simulated_ratings.title: The Adventures of Robin Hood (1938)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Classic swashbuckling heroics and romance hit my sweet spot.

simulated_ratings.title: The Mark of Zorro (1940)
simulated_ratings.feeling: The masked-identity derring-do and swordplay are irresistible.

simulated_ratings.title: The Crimson Pirate (1952)

simulated_ratings.title: High Noon (1952)

simulated_ratings.title: Rio Bravo (1959)

simulated_ratings.title: The Searchers (1956)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Impressive scope but the darker journey kept me at arm’s length.

simulated_ratings.title: The Big Country (1958)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Handsomer than it is stirring, but the feud and vistas land.

simulated_ratings.title: The Bridge on the River Kwai (1957)

simulated_ratings.title: Paths of Glory (1957)

simulated_ratings.feeling: Rousing POW ingenuity that scratches my adventure itch.

simulated_ratings.title: The Best Years of Our Lives (1946)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Human, hopeful Americana that moved me without fuss.

simulated_ratings.feeling: Silky suspense and wit, paced like a brisk cross-country chase.

simulated_ratings.feeling: Sultry espionage, clipped tension, and real stakes—right up my alley.

simulated_ratings.title: Laura (1944)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Elegant mystery with just enough romantic obsession to hook me.

simulated_ratings.title: The Third Man (1949)

simulated_ratings.title: Double Indemnity (1944)

simulated_ratings.title: Rebecca (1940)

simulated_ratings.title: Primal Fear (1996)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Lean, gripping courtroom mystery that kept me leaning forward.

simulated_ratings.title: Zodiac (2007)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Methodical and absorbing, if a bit clinical for my taste.

simulated_ratings.title: The Prestige (2006)

simulated_ratings.title: L.A. Confidential (1997)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Sleek, absorbing noir whose cold polish keeps me slightly at bay.

simulated_ratings.title: Knives Out (2019)

simulated_ratings.title: The Princess Bride (1987)

simulated_ratings.title: Jaws (1975)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Tense seafaring hunt I respect, though the horror edge tempers my enjoyment.

simulated_ratings.title: Wait Until Dark (1967)
